definition: to save or redeem (a situation)/to mediate/to intercede
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
circle/encircle
circle/round
to have room to save a situation/margin for error (idiom)

sentences.english: The mistake is further than remedy.
sentences.chinese: 這個舛誤是無法轉圜的。

sentences.english: Then John Alden began explaining and smoothing the matter.
sentences.chinese: 約翰奧爾登這纔開始解釋，以彌補轉圜。

sentences.english: The model left banks with strikingly few alternatives in a crisis.
sentences.chinese: 這個模式在危機中幾乎沒有給銀行留下轉圜的餘地。

definition: conclusion/judgment/verdict
to dabble and stop (idiom); to dip into/to attempt half-heartedly/content with a smattering of knowledge
to write off at one stroke
toil/hard work
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
authority over the household
to feel embarrassed/to feel akward
in a short while/presently
fight to the death/desperate struggle
to treat one another with absolute sincerity (idiom); to show total devotion
to ask oneself honestly/to search in one's heart
shameful secret
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
to cut weeds and eliminate the roots (idiom); to destroy root and branch/to eliminate completely
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
